com.hippikon.security
Class PermissionsFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.hippikon.security.PermissionsFactory
public abstract class PermissionsFactory
extends java.lang.Object

The PermissionsFactory class provides a convenient and simple mechanism for obtaining a PermissionSet for a ProtectedResource made by a user within an AuthorizationContext.

Once a user has been authenticated, a user may need access to different resources within an application. Each application may provide its own authorization policy implementations to serve its specific needs. The authorization API can therefore said to be a framework, where the hooks for extensibility and specialization are in the form of Policy implementations.

To obtain a PermissionSet for a ProtectedResource:

 try {
     AuthorizationContext ctx = // a context object should be available
     ProtectedResource res = // a business object

     PermissionSet resPerms = PermissionsFactory.getPermissions(res, ctx);

     if (resPerms.canRead()) {
         // do something
     }
 } catch (IllegalAuthorizationException e) {
     // log and direct to error page
 } catch (ResourceNotFoundException re) {
     // this is an application error
 }

Since:
JDK 1.2.2

Method Detail

getPermissions

public static PermissionSet getPermissions(ProtectedResource res,
                                           AuthorizationContext ctx)
                                    throws IllegalAuthorizationException,
                                           ResourceNotFoundException
Returns the complete PermissionSet for a ProtectedResource being accessed within a AuthorizationContext.

Parameters:
res - the ProtectedResource being accessed
ctx - the AuthorizationContext containing data about an authenticated user
Throws:
IllegalAuthorizationException - thrown if the AuthorizationContext contains invalid data or the use accessing the ProtectedResource can not be authorized. This is semantically different than if the user is not allowed to access the resource; in this case no flags will be set on the PermissionSet object returned.
ResourceNotFoundException - thrown if no entry in the PolicyStore can be located in order to determine the PermissionSet object to return

getPermissions

public static PermissionSet getPermissions(java.lang.Class c,
                                           AuthorizationContext ctx)
                                    throws IllegalAuthorizationException,
                                           ResourceNotFoundException
Returns the complete PermissionsSet for a class of ProtectedResource being accessed within a AuthorizationContext. This provided mainly to determine if new instances of the class may be created. In this case, the PermissionSet.canCreate() flag will return true.

Parameters:
c - a class that inherits the ProtectedResource class that is being accessed
ctx - the AuthorizationContext containing data about an authenticated user
Throws:
IllegalAuthorizationException - thrown if the AuthorizationContext contains invalid data or the user accessing the ProtectedResource can not be authorized. This is semantically different than if the user is not allowed to access the resource; in this case no flags will be set on the PermissionSet object returned.
ResourceNotFoundException - thrown if no entry in the PolicyStore can be located in order to determine the PermissionSet object to return

getPermissions

public static PermissionSet getPermissions(ProtectedResource res,
                                           java.lang.Class c,
                                           AuthorizationContext ctx)
                                    throws IllegalAuthorizationException,
                                           ResourceNotFoundException
A convenience method provided to remove the need to create a new List if there is only one parent ProtectedResource object that may contain child objects.

Parameters:
res - the parent ProtectedResource that may have rules defined for child ProtectedResource objects
c - a class that inherits the ProtectedResource class that is being accessed
ctx - the AuthorizationContext containing data about an authenticated user
Throws:
IllegalAuthorizationException - thrown if the AuthorizationContext contains invalid data or the user accessing the ProtectedResource can not be authorized. This is semantically different than if the user is not allowed to access the resource; in this case no flags will be set on the PermissionSet object returned.
ResourceNotFoundException - thrown if no entry in the PolicyStore can be located in order to determine the PermissionSet object to return

getPermissions

public static PermissionSet getPermissions(java.util.List resources,
                                           java.lang.Class c,
                                           AuthorizationContext ctx)
                                    throws IllegalAuthorizationException,
                                           ResourceNotFoundException
Returns the complete PermissionSet for a class of ProtectedResource being accessed in the context of a List of ProtectedResource objects. The PermissionSet returned will include the combination of all the ProtectedResources objects, along plus those defined for the Class. The class permissions will not include any user ACLs since an instance is required in order to execute the Policy.determineUserPrincipals() method.

Parameters:
resources - a list of ProtectedResource objects that define the object hierachy within which a Class is defined
c - the Class being accessed within an AuthorizationContext. The class must be a subtype of ProtectedResource
Throws:
IllegalAuthorizationException - thrown if the AuthorizationContext contains invalid data or the user accessing the ProtectedResource can not be authorized
ResourceNotFoundException - thrown in no entry in the PolicyStore can be located in order to determine the PermissionSet object to return

getPermissions

public static PermissionSet getPermissions(java.util.List resources,
                                           AuthorizationContext ctx)
                                    throws IllegalAuthorizationException,
                                           ResourceNotFoundException
Returns the complete PermissionSet for a ProtectedResource being accessed within an AuthorizationContext, where the PermissionSet is influenced by a hierachy of ProtectedResources.

Some resources may need to inherit the permissions of parent objects, or be affected by other resources in an application. In these cases, the complete set of ProtectedResources should be passed into this method as an array populated in the order of the hierachy. The last entry in the list is the actual ProtectedResource being accessed by a user.

The hierachy of resource names must match an ACL structure defined in a PolicyStore. If a hierachy is not defined in the PolicyStore, each PermissionSet will be retrieved and combined to compute the final PermissionSet.

Parameters:
resources - an array of ProtectedResource objects listed in order of importance. This may mirror a hierachy of objects that influence lower order entries. In the event a matching hierachy entry can not be located in the appropriate PolicyStore the authorization framework will attempt to retrieve the top-level PermissionSet objects for each ProtectedResource in the array and combine them using an OR logical operation.
Returns:
the complete PermissionSet of a ProtectedResource being accessed with an AuthorizationContext and influenced by othe ProtectedResources in an application
Throws:
IllegalAuthorizationException
ResourceNotFoundException
